data.name: ActivateButtonText
data.value: Activate

data.name: ActivatedMessageHtml
data.value: {1} Data is active. Thank you.

data.name: MatchCaption
data.value: UserAgent Test Results

data.name: ActivateInstructionsHtml
data.value: Paste your data licence key into the textbox below. Select "Activate" to use the licence key with this web site.

data.name: ActivationFailureCouldNotUpdateConfigHtml
data.value:
The fiftyOne/detection element of the config file '{1}' could not be inserted. Please ensure the following text is present between the fiftyOne tags and try activating the licence key again.


< detection  binaryFilePath = "~/App_Data/51Degrees-Premium.dat" />

data.name: ActivationFailureCouldNotWriteDataFileHtml
data.value: The device data file '{1}' could not be saved. Check the user '{2}' has write access to the folder, or change the folder location to one with write access.

data.name: ActivationFailureCouldNotWriteLicenceFileHtml
data.value: The licence file '{1}' could not be written to this web sites bin folder '{2}'. Create a text file with the extension .lic and paste the licence key into the file. Save the text file in the bin folder.

data.name: ActivationFailureGenericHtml
data.value: Whoops. There was a problem activating the licence key or uploading premium data. We're unsure why this happened. Please Contact Us providing details of your web site implementation, relevent entries from your log file, and we'll try and help you.

data.name: ActivationFailureHttpHtml
data.value:
We were unable to reach the 51Degrees licence validation web site at the host '{1}'. This could be for one of the following reasons.

  • This web site is running in medium trust mode and the originUrl attribute in the web.config does not allow access the host '{1}'. Change the originUrl to include '{1}'. Multiple host names can be seperated by | signs.
  • The web servers firewall or another firewall is blocking access to the host or the SSL port 443. Check the firewall configuration.

When you've completed these checks try activating the licence key again.

data.name: ActivationFailureInvalidHtml
data.value: The licence key provided failed validation. Please check the license key is validate with your reseller.

data.name: ActivationSuccessHtml
data.value: Success. Select the "Refresh" button to reload the web page and and start using Device Data. Note: There may be a short delay as the application restarts.

data.name: BackButtonDeviceText
data.value: Other {0} Devices

data.name: BackButtonDevicesText
data.value: Other Vendors

data.name: FiftyOneDegreesUrl
data.value: http://51Degrees.com/Products/DeviceData

data.name: JavaScriptToggle
PropertyDictionaryLegend
data.value:
Legend

Indicates the data set versions the property is contained within.

The strongly typed value the property returns when used with APIs which support strong types.

[L] = the property can return multiple values as a list.

[O] = the property is obsolete and will be replaced in a future version. See the description for details of the newer preferred method.

data.name: RelatedDevicesHeading
data.value: Related Browser & Software Combinations

data.name: ToggleToolTip
data.value: Show or hide available values

data.name: UpgradeHtml
data.value:
Thank you for using Lite device data from 51Degrees. You can now upgrade to Premium data whenever you want, giving you a range of benefits that include:

- Automatically redirecting users to optimised web pages, enabling you to create separate sites for tablets, feature phones and smartphones.

- Enhancing the IsMobile and Screen Size properties in Lite data with over 50 device properties including IsTablet, screen size in millimetres, vendor, model, platform details, input methods and levels of javascript support.

- Regular weekly updates of device data

- An option to automatically install new updates

{2} | Learn More

data.value: Find Device

data.name: UserAgentTesterInstructions
data.value: Enter the User Agent String to test and press the Find Device button.

data.value: Select a model to view its hardware specifications.

data.name: DeviceExplorerVendorsHtml
data.value: Select a hardware vendor to view the device models produced. Alternatively search for devices by model or popular name.

data.name: PropertyDictionaryInstructions
data.value: The list of properties and descriptions explain how to use the available device data. Use the [+] icon to display possible values associated with the property.

data.value: The data source provided does not contain valid data.

data.name: FinderFreeTextLabelText
data.value: Enter key word to search

data.name: FinderFreeTextLabelToolTip
data.value: Enter the key word in the pattern "Nokia N95". Single word pattern will check against both Vendor and Model.

data.name: FinderModelLabelText
data.value: Select Model

data.name: FinderModelLabelToolTip
data.value: Select Device Model from the selected Vendor ex: N95

data.name: FinderVendorLabelText
data.value: Select Vendor

data.name: FinderVendorLabelToolTip
data.value: Select Device Vendor to search ex: Nokia

data.name: StatsRefreshButtonText
data.value: Refresh Data

data.name: RedirectDevicesFileToolTip
data.value: A file used to store the details of devices that have previously accessed the web site to determine if they're making a subsequent request. Needed to ensure multiple worker processes have a consistent view of previous activity. (Optional – random behaviour will be experienced if not specified on web sites with more than one worker processes). In Windows Azure this value becomes the name of devices cloud table that will be used instead of a file.

data.name: RedirectEnabledToolTip
data.value: If unchecked redirection will be disabled.

data.name: RedirectFirstRequestOnlyToolTip
data.value: If set to true only the first request received by the web site is redirected to the mobileUrl when the site is accessed from a mobile device. (Optional – defaults to true)

data.name: RedirectLocationFilterMatchExpressionToolTip
data.value: A regular expression used to evaluate the value of the property. (Mandatory)

data.name: RedirectLocationFilterPropertyToolTip
data.value: The property of HttpRequest, HttpRequest.Browser or 51Degrees property to use when evaluating the matchExpression attribute. (Mandatory)

data.name: RedirectLocationFiltersToolTip
data.value: The location element contains a collection of criteria or filters that all need to match for the location to be used.

data.name: RedirectLocationMatchExpressionToolTip
data.value: Can be used to provide a regular expression which will take the requesting URL as input match segments to be used in place of numeric parameters contained within {} in the url attribute. (Optional)

data.name: RedirectLocationNameToolTip
data.value: A unique identifier for the location. Used for debugging in the log file.(Mandatory)

data.name: RedirectLocationUrlToolTip
data.value: URL of the redirect location to use if all the properties in the collection match. (Mandatory)

data.name: RedirectMobilePagesRegexToolTip
data.value: A regular expression that when applied to the current request Path (context.Request.AppRelativeCurrentExecutionFilePath) or the requesting Urlwill return true if it should be considered a mobile page. Use this attribute to tell redirection about mobile pages derived from base classes such as System.Web.UI.Page. Redirection needs to be aware of mobile pages so that requests to these pages can be ignored. Any page that derives from System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage will automatically be treated as a mobile page irrespective of this attribute. (Optional)

data.name: RedirectMobileRedirectUrlToolTip
data.value: A URL to direct mobile devices to instead of the normal web sites landing page. Will be used after all the locations have been evaluated if one did not match and a mobile device is present. (Optional)

data.name: RedirectOriginalUrlAsQueryStringToolTip
data.value: If set to true the redirected URL will have the original requesting Url encoded and included as the origUrl query string parameter in the redirected Url. This will enable the mobile home page to determine the original requested resource providing the option to display a mobile friendly version. (Optional [but highly recommended] – defaults to false)

data.name: RedirectTimeoutToolTip
data.value: The number of minutes of inactivity that should occur before the requesting device should be treated as making a new request to the web site for the purposes of redirection. If the session is available the session timeout will be used and override this value. (Optional -defaults to 20 minutes)

data.name: RedirectUpdateGeneralFailureHtml
data.value:
Exception updating configuration '{0}'.

Check the web sites application pool identity can modify the configuration files. If operating in a Medium trust environment switch to Full trust to complete the configuration changes.

Alternatively cut and paste the following XML into your configuration file.

{1}

data.name: RedirectUpdateSuccessHtml
data.value:
Configuration updated successfully.

The application may need to be restarted for the redirection rules to become active.

data.name: RedirectButtonNewLocationText
data.value: New Location

data.name: ShareUsageText
data.value: Share usage data with 51Degrees

data.name: ShareUsageErrorHtml
data.value: There was a problem recording your share usage data preference. If the web site is operating in a medium trust environment or modify permission to the configuration file(s) is not granted to the application pool identity you will have to change this value in the configuration file manually. Find the fiftyOne/detection element in the config file and set the shareUsage attribute.

data.name: ShareUsageFalseHtml
data.value:
We're sorry you've decided not to share usage data. We hope you'll reconsider as usage data helps us provide you a better product. Find out more here.
You may need to restart the web site for the change to become effective.

data.name: ShareUsageLinkText
data.value: Learn More

data.name: ShareUsageTrueHtml
data.value:
Thank you for sharing usage data and helping improve this product.
You may need to restart the web site for the change to become effective.

data.name: ShareUsageUrl
data.value: https://51degrees.com/support/faqs/usage-data

data.value: Search

data.value: Vendor, Model or Popular Name

data.name: TopDevicesText
data.value: Displaying the top {0} latest devices.

data.name: AutoUpdateErrorHtml
data.value: There was a problem recording the configuration change. If the web site is operating in a medium trust environment or modify permission to the configuration file(s) is not granted to the application pool identity you will have to change this value in the configuration file manually. Find the fiftyOne/detection element in the config file and set the autoUpdate attribute.

data.name: AutoUpdateFalseHtml
data.value:
Automatic data file updates are disabled.
You may need to restart the web site for the change to become effective.

data.name: AutoUpdateText
data.value: Enable automatic data file updates

data.name: AutoUpdateTrueHtml
data.value:
Automatic data file updates are enabled.
You may need to restart the web site for the change to become effective.

data.name: DeviceDetectionErrorHtml
data.value: There was a problem recording the configuration change. If the web site is operating in a medium trust environment or modify permission to the configuration file(s) is not granted to the application pool identity you will have to change this value in the configuration file manually. Find the fiftyOne/detection element in the config file and set the enabled attribute.

data.name: DeviceDetectionFalseHtml
data.value:
Device detection is disabled.
You may need to restart the web site for the change to become effective.

data.name: DeviceDetectionText
data.value: Enable device detection

data.name: DeviceDetectionTrueHtml
data.value:
Device detection is enabled.
You may need to restart the web site for the change to become effective.

data.name: ImageOptimiserErrorHtml
data.value: There was a problem recording the change to image optimisation. If the web site is operating in a medium trust environment or modify permission to the configuration file(s) is not granted to the application pool identity you will have to change this value in the configuration file manually. Find the fiftyOne/imageOptimisation element in the config file and set the enabled attribute.

data.name: ImageOptimiserFalseHtml
data.value:
Image optimisation features are now disabled.
You may need to restart the web site for the change to become effective.

data.name: ImageOptimiserText
data.value: Enable image optimisation features

data.name: ImageOptimiserTrueHtml
data.value:
Image optimisation features are now enabled.
You may need to restart the web site for the change to become effective.
